metadata.title: CVE-2020-14040 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.description: The x/text package before 0.3.3 for Go has a vulnerability in encoding/unicode that could lead to the UTF-16 decoder entering an infinite loop, causing the program to crash or run out of memory. An attacker could provide a single byte to a UTF16 decoder instantiated with UseBOM or ExpectBOM to trigger an infinite loop if the String function on the Decoder is called, or the Decoder is passed to golang.org/x/text/transform.String.

criterions.comment: golang-golang-x-text package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.3.5-1').
